DOC.brief_summary: This multi-centre randomise control trial compare early jejunal feeding ( use frictional nasojejunal [ NJ ] tube ) standard feed critical illness .
DOC.brief_title: The Early Nasojejunal Tube Meet Energy Requirements Intensive Care ( ENTERIC ) Study
DOC.criteria: ICU patient eligible enrolment meet following : Age > 18 year old In ICU < 48 hour prior enrolment Receiving invasive mechanical ventilation ( endotracheal tube tracheostomy , NOT facemask ) anticipate need > 48 hour mechanical ventilation Receiving continuous infusion one : morphine > 2 mg/hour , fentanyl > 20 mcg/hour , pethidine > 20 mg/hour Either single GRV > 150 ml ( whilst receive EN via NG tube ) nasogastric drainage > 500 ml 12 hour ( whether receive EN ) Patients ineligible enrolment meet following : Previous recent surgery alter anatomy upper gastrointestinal tract ( eg . oesophagectomy , gastrectomy , gastric anastomosis surgery , gastroplasty , pyloroplasty , pancreaticoduodenectomy [ Whipple â€™ procedure ] ) Known gastric malignancy Known oesophageal varix Current admission peptic ulceration Current mechanical bowel obstruction Current gastrostomy , jejunostomy , surgicallyplaced enteral tube situ Contraindication use nose mouth enteral tube insertion ( eg . recent facial trauma surgery ) Receiving nutritional support prior ICU admission Severe coagulopathy ( defined platelet count < 20 and/or international normalize ratio [ INR ] > 4.0 )
